resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

kszucs opened a new pull request #7439:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7439


   Currently testing it, sadly docker-compose doesn't support nvidia runtime so some additional documentation and/or archery development is required.

kszucs commented on pull request #7439:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7439#issuecomment-644326074


   I'm going to add some extra hack to compile the `docker-compose run` command directly to `docker run`, just needs to merge #6512 to prevent conflicts.

kszucs commented on pull request #7439:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7439#issuecomment-645593482


   Please verify it with the following command:
   
   ```bash
   $ archery docker run --no-pull ubuntu-cuda-cpp
   $ archery docker run --no-pull ubuntu-cuda-python
   $ archery docker run --no-pull ubuntu-cuda-docs
   ```
   
   Note that it requires docker version >=19.03.
   I successfully tested all three images.

kszucs edited a comment on pull request #7439:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7439#issuecomment-645593482


   Please verify it with the following command:
   
   ```bash
   $ archery docker run --no-pull ubuntu-cuda-cpp
   $ archery docker run --no-pull ubuntu-cuda-python
   $ archery docker run --no-pull ubuntu-cuda-docs
   ```
   
   Note that it requires docker version >=19.03.
   I successfully tested all three images.
   
   @wesm @kou perhaps you have necessary devices.

fields.description: This needs to be updated to build with CUDA support (which in turn will require the host machine to have nvidia-docker), among other things
fields.summary: [Documentation] Add a docker-compose entry which builds the documentation with CUDA enabled

comments.body: We need CUDA support to build API documentation?
Just read the description, the docs are built without CUDA enabled, so it is valid.
